Lars Clausen wrote:

> I've been doing a little investigation into the memory problems in
> Heritrix.  I'm doing unit tests on Heritrix as part of our project, and
> there noticed that running Heritrix several times in a row used a lot of
> memory, about 100M per run.  I found a memory debugger for Java
> (http://jb2works.com/refscan/) <http://jb2works.com/refscan/%29> which 
> showed me one thing that was in the
> archive packages and linear in the number of Heritrix runs:  The
> loggers.  For each run, there is one instance of each of
> org.archive.crawler.io.LocalErrorFormatter,
> org.archive.crawler.io.RuntimeErrorFormatter,
> org.archive.crawler.io.StatisticsLogFormatter,
> org.archive.crawler.io.UriErrorFormatter, and
> org.archive.crawler.io.UriProcessingFormatter, and 5 of
> org.archive.io.GenerationFileHandler.  Can't go much further as I don't
> have my system set up for compiling Heritrix, but maybe this will be
> useful to somebody.

Thank you for the above Lars.  We were keeping around references to the 
job loggers.  I've just added clearing of the references at end of job 
completion.  I did some more end-of-job housekeeping while I was at it.  
There are still some processors that should register for end of job 
cleanup but I won't worry about them for now since memory retained is small.

I've not experienced Heritrix holding 100megs per job -- at least not 
since close of '[1055592 ] terminated crawl still hogging memory, 
causing OOM' 
(https://sourceforge.net/tracker/index.php?func=detail&aid=1055592&group_id=73833&atid=539099)
This bug was fixed post-1.2.0 release on 2004-12-10 so fix is currently 
only in HEAD.  I can run at least ten jobs in series without OOME'ing in 
a 128meg heap.  For sure there is a problem if you're seeing 100megs 
retained per job.  Lets try and figure it out.

St.Ack
